data.title: Super helpful and willing to educate you!
data.text: They are super helpful and very willing to take the time to educate you on the different and varied options you may have.  They even have a range where you can try it out.  There are also classes available.

data.title: Nice People, Love Archery
data.text:
Stopped by the Wilderness Archery shop in Rocklin in the early summer, and have meant to go back and buy a recurve, but I've been so busy I haven't gotten there to do a more thorough review than a look-see. 

The facility is pretty good, and does allow you to do some practicing and to try out some work. It is a great facility to introduce beginners to the art of archery. 

I'd recommend this facility to anyone who is even thinking of seeing what the sport is like or, even better, if there are kids in your group and want to know what it's about. 

Got to get ready for the fall!!!

data.title: First Archery Try-Ever
data.text: Given as a gift, two of went together for the first time and loved the experience. Our instructor was all about safety. Yes! Very thorough instructions and there for questions, tweaks, and encouragement. I felt I wanted to use my "other" arm and he had no problem letting me get comfortable with what suited me best. As it turned out-he know best. Had a great fun time.

data.title: My son loved it!
data.text: My son wanted to try archery and this was a great play to do so.  the staff were extremely friendly and gave my son a quick lesson on how to hold and shoot the arrows.  Highly recommend for archery practice.

data.title: If you're looking for archery experts, this is your store
data.text: This is where I shop for my archery equipment. The staff is very knowledgeable and helpful. You get the personal attention you can't get at the big sporting good stores or mega hunting & fishing chain stores. This is an archery only store.

data.title: Fantastic and safe family activity with skilled instructors.
data.text: I made a weekend out of archery for my two granddaughters by first attending a class at Wilderness Archery and then the Mockingjay Part 1 movie. The instructor stressed safety while making the class fun. My girls were hitting the target in no time and even got some arrows in the bullseye. While we were walking out of class, the girls were already asking when they could come back again. My daughter got so jealous of our fun that now I'm taking all 4 of us for another class in Dec to celebrate her birthday. You've got to try this..it's safe, instructive and challenging. The facility and especially the staff are great.
